name: ingloriously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that that does not deserve admiration, praise, or honour: She lost her balance and tumbled ingloriously to the ground. His international career ended ingloriously with a defeat to Sweden in a World Cup qualifying match.
More examplesFewer examplesHe ended up in London after being ingloriously expelled from his expensive boarding school.Her Sunday morning show ran for only five months before it was ingloriously dumped by the TV network.He tried to save the struggling business, but failed ingloriously.
